Weekdays are best to go when tables are easy to get. Weekends can be crazy with a horde of people waiting outside and the place is jam packed. Free coffee for the patrons braving the elements makes it worth the while.
Toast is one of my go-to places on days when I need a good breakfast! The staff is always super friendly and the food is delicious.
An amazing breakfast every time. I love that there are so many healthy choices and I love the turkey bacon.

Finally got around to trying this place after eagerly awaiting the replacement for the awful Cafe Really.  I had high hopes after hearing good reviews from neighbours.

Toast fell below my expectations.  I ordered the corned beef hash after the waiter recommended it.  I don't want to say it was out of a can, but it tasted like it.  Corned beef hash is hit and miss usually, so my I didn't have high hopes.  I ordered my eggs over-medium (they advertize that they only use pasteurized eggs) but they came out over-easy.  The hollandaise sauce was not great either.  It looked like my plate had been sitting a few minutes before it came out.  

The wheat toast I ordered was pretty good.  Coffee was good.

Others in my party ordered an omelet.  They thought it was good.  I tasted it and thought it was so-so.  The crepes were too sweet for the person that ordered them, but I didn't try them myself.  We also ordered a la carte bacon and pancakes.  Both were good.

This brings me to one disappointing aspect of the restaurant.  Everything is a la carte.  So my breakfast cost me $9 for the hash, $2 for coffee, and $1 for toast.  I felt this was too much for what I got and the way it was prepared.  As another poster mentioned, the portion was pretty small. 

Service was really good.  Every staffer was friendly and helpful.  Water and coffee refilled often.  Staff are why I will try the place again.  I will also order something else and give it another shot, maybe at lunch too.

I really want this place to succeed.  The little plaza needs them there.  I hope the owners increase food quality and portion, and watch what they charge.

I've been to Toast Ballantyne five or six times.  The food is okay; one time my potato hash browns had a piece of black netting cooked into it, but my server apologized and I didn't hold it against them (I've been back a few more times since that incident).  However, their hostess this weekend 3/14/2015, was a very unpleasant individual.  My party (a group of 5) arrived and were told it would be a 15 minute wait for breakfast (we arrived to the hostess stand around 10:50 am).  All the other groups that arrived to put their names in the same time as me were told the same approximate wait time.  After waiting about 30 minutes, I observed that all the other people who arrived at the same time as me were already seated and people who had arrived much later than my party were now being seated.  I asked the hostess again, how much longer until we would be seated (without looking to see where were on the list), told me a little while.  After 40 minutes (11:30), I asked again, and was told if my group of 5 wanted to squeeze at a table for 4 we could be seated "when that table is done" the hostess said pointing at a table that was still eating.  By this point, I had watched several groups of 4 that had arrived much later than my group, get seated (at 4-top tables) and was very insulted that after waiting so long we were now going to have to squeeze into a table too small for us (that we should have been offered before all those other groups.  When I asked the hostess, if we were going to be squeezed at a 4-top, when did she seat others before us, she tried to lie and tell me "no we are going down the list in order."  I could see that was not the case by looking at the list (and seeing multiple names crossed off the list under my name) and by standing there for 40 minutes and observing people coming in, waiting, and being seated.  Meanwhile, as new people came in to put their names down, she was still telling them a 15-20 minute wait.  I find that hard to believe when I had already waited 40 minutes.  

I understand the weekends are busy.  I was more than happy to wait to get seated (especially the 15 minute wait I was told).  But I don't appreciated being ignored by the hostess, brushed off when asking how much longer (after 30 minutes of waiting) and watching other groups come in, but their names on the wait list, and get seated.  Then, after a 40 minute wait, to get offered a 4-top table that other people were still seated at and eating (and told it would be a few more minutes).  An apology by the hostess for the delay, or for skipping over us, would have been nice.  Instead the condescending way she addressed me and offered me a table (that people were still seated at and eating) after a 40 minute wait was too much.  I will never go back to Toast.  I will never recommend it to anyone.
Free Coffee while you wait. Not a lot of seating, but great breakfast food. Blueberry stuffed French toast is amazing.  Ask for bacon crunchy bc they tend to undercook it.

My gluten free toast was burnt, not just burnt but charred. No idea how they missed that. The avocado omelet was cold and the filling was in a big glob in the center. The cheese wasn't even melted. The breakfast potatoes were cold and hard around the edges, but had good flavor so I imagine they're pleasant when warm. We were charged for three large orange juices when we only got two. After asking the cashier to fix it, she did not. I noticed but I just paid for it anyway because I couldn't get out of there fast enough. Disliked the team server setup, reduced accountability. The Toastery was overpriced, paid almost $50 for breakfast for two adults and one child. Would not recommend.
Love this place! My husband and I eat here regularly. The food is very good, and I feel it is reasonably priced.

The tables wobbled, and the staff dived in all dirty dishes.  
            The table that my family and I sat at had major leveling problems. I tried to remedy with the sugar packs, but to no avail.
        Front of house staff bussed tables with all fingers  in glasses, which is a major germ spreading process. I hope they have a large budget for hand soap, or someone will get sick certainly soon from suck terrible busing habits. 
       We were giving the bill as our food arrived, and then the attentiveness of our server was missing in action. I had to get up for coffee refill and napkins. I had to also flag a another server for a fork. 
       The highlight of the meal, was my wife's burger,  which she loved. It did however fall apart as she ate it, but it was wells seasoned and good quality. The kids liked their Mac and cheese, and the kids menu with activities was a nice touch for keeping the little ones occupied.
       I think if Toast would readjust their serving etiquette and busing processes to be more in line with proper service standards, I would give it another try.

Came here for brunch on a Sunday. Quote time to get sat was 25 mins. We saw a few chairs available at the bar area and decided to sit there instead. Bar area is small. I think it sits approx 5 people. Service was great. 

We each got an omelette. Omelettes were huge. I got a side of salsa with it and it was delicious. I got the western omelette and it had ham, onions and green peppers and cheese. Everything was good but the onions and peppers were huge. I also had a lot of peppers in my omelette. I got cinnamon raisin toast and put a slather of butter on it and it was good. 

They do serve you cornbread at the beginning of the meal. I'm not a fan of cornbread so I didn't try it but my friend and fianc√© did and said it was good but they wished it was served warm. They said it was cold. 

My fianc√© got a Bloody Mary and loved it. My friend got the mimosa and said they put in just the right amount of orange juice in it. 

Overall, we would all definitely go back again. My only complaint is that I had my purse hanging on my chair and someone that walked by (possibly a food runner or server) spilled coffee on my purse without telling me! When I got to my car I saw a huge coffee stain on it. I wish they would of just told me or offered a wet towel to help me clean it up.
Always a great option! Love the breakfast items & ability to order breakfast anytime. Best coffee around. We've always had great service as well.

Came here on New Years Day and wow, it was exactly what I needed. My friends and I ordered mimosas and Bloody Marys, they were perfect. If you want your Bloody Mary spicy, you have to ask or just add hot sauce yourself. I got the Breakfast burrito and biscuits with gravy. Probably, best biscuits study gravy I've ever had. It's just so good, you just keep wanting more of it.

I would give this place 5 stars but the service was off. I was not sure who was my waiter/waitress. Whenever I got that figured out, my waitress seemed tired or something because she did not interact with us at all.  I wanted to order another Bloody Mary but she was never around to check on us so I went up to the bar to order one. A gentlemen told me I had to order from my waitress.....problem...she never checks on our table. I do know the waitress's name but she needs to cheer up. 

I love this place and would recommend it to anyone, hopefully you won't have the same waitress I did.

This was my third and probably last time to Toast, I was severely not impressed.  On a positive note, the food was "OKAY". I had the French Toast combo with the peanut butter and banana stuffed French toast which was average.. Nothing out of this world, but okay.  Their coffee is amazing,  which I liked. Now on to the negative,  the service was awful!! My server approached our table with a terrible attitude.  I asked him what he recommended from their menu and he provided no positive input. We basically ordered whatever we thought sounded good. Then,  my girlfriend and I politely asked for our basket of corn bread in which he quickly forgot and never came back to our table until our breakfast was served. We had to remind him and that's when he came back with it.  After that he never came back around to see if we were okay.  I flagged him down for our check and a refill on my coffee; and ONCE AGAIN he forgot. I had to ask a second employee for a refill since my own server never came back to my table.  

My girlfriend and I left the restaurant with a bad taste in our mouth from the bad service we received. Let's just say,  it's definitely NOT worth it unless you're looking for good coffee... And good luck trying to get a refill!
Great food, great service! The food was well prepared and everyone was friendly and inviting! Will definitely be back!

Let me start out by saying the Boy and I have been trying to find a new "regular" breakfast place, since we've just moved to the area.  

This past Saturday we tried Toast as it was the next in our "Breakfast Places" list.  

We got there and it was bit crowded, about a 10-15 minute wait for our party of two.  If you are anything other than a party of two, I would suggest you get there early.  

We were seated and handed menus and our drink order was taken.  They must use a "team service" style model as the person who brought us our coffee was not the same person who took our food order, nor was that the same person who came to check on us later, but they were all friendly, and I didn't feel rushed.  

We both ordered coffees and we were graciously given a basket of corn bread with apple butter.  The cornbread was good, the apple butter was good.  The apple butter ON the cornbread, not so good, but there was butter on the table so I didn't even have to ask for it.  

I got an Avocado Omlette with home fries and rye toast.  The Boy got Spinach Quiche with fresh fruit and grits.  

The omlette was good but it was huge.  It must ahve been a three egg omlette, I could only eat half.  The homefries were good, just what I was expecting.  The toast was toast.  It's hard to mess it up.  

The Boy's quiche was the best quiche I had ever tasted.  It had spinach, feta, and olives.  It was AMAZING.  The grits were really good.  They had a coarser texture than some of the other grits we've had and really had a corn flavor.  

All in all, we'll definitely be back.

The human toast waving at me on the corner of Rea Road and Williams Pond Road lured me in during lunch time and boy am I glad he/she did. A friend and I went during our lunch break an we were immediately greeted by a smiling host who allowed us to choose where we wanted to sit. As we sat down within seconds our waiter came and took our drink order and provided us with menus. My friend and I took one look at the specials menu for the day and knew instantly what we wanted. She ordered the chicken salad with strawberries, pears, almonds, brie, and other goodies and I ordered the crab salad rolls. The food was so delicious we hardly spoke. After our meal ended we were paid a visit by the manager who asked how our meal was. Our response, "fantastic!". 

I'd like to come back with my family and try their breakfast.

Consistently great food and service even during busy hours such as Sunday brunch. The wait is never ridiculous thanks to efficient staff who manage to flip tables quickly. The omelettes and benedicts are always great. The cocktails are also to die for.

This is placed is packed on weekends but the service is quick, the food prepared quickly and delicious too. I rarely eat breakfast out but I'd come back to this place if I didn't feel like cooking. French toast is awesome and the biscuits yummy.
Have never been let down! Their red velvet waffles are a must try!! it is slightly pricey though!

This place is good! The service is impeccable and the food is delicious and quick. I really enjoy their breakfast menu, I haven't had lunch there yet but I hope to soon. The only drawback is it is on the expensive side for a place that serves your typical fare at high quality. All in all, I am a fan.
Wonderful place. Their motto is every waiter is your waiter. Food is good. Service excellent.

We've been going to FT for brunch for a couple of years, and the food has *generally* been pretty good. 

The last two trips have been disappointing. On our most recent visit, on a weekday, my wife ordered the western BLT, and got a different sandwich. I ordered the Florentine Benedict the last two visits. I ordered it a second time in hopes that the first was an unusual occurrence. Nope. Same both times. The eggs were hard poached instead of oozing. I don't know what the sauce was, but it wasn't Hollandaise--not even a hint of lemon. 

As I said, the food at FT is generally pretty good, but until they get a chef who knows how to poach an egg and make a decent Hollandaise, I'd avoid the Benedicts. They're just awful.

FT tried to make it right by cutting the check in half, but all that meant was we paid half price for unacceptable food. We reduced the tip because our waiter didn't check in even once after we were served. 

So disappointing, considering how good the place has been in the past.

Delish! I had the Cali Benny egg specialty, was seasoned perfected and the poached eggs hit the spot. The strawberries and cream French toast is AMAZING. Will be coming here more often. Service was quick and precise.

Four star breakfast / traditional and modern American meals with flair - Cali Benedict is fresh and cool thanks to the avocados and tomatoes - they customized it to my taste and were very accommodating. I'll be back!

If you really want to have a great breakfast,brunch or lunch you'll not find a better place to dine than TOAST.
The choices are endless and whatever you decide upon will be a winner
The service cannot be beat. Food comes out hot ,if that's what's required or chilled if it's to be cold.
The staff is marvelous and everyone pitches in to make your experience wonderful.
Brian and Patrick Burchill know what it takes to make a restaurant successful and it shows from the managers,servers and busing staff. The staff truly seems happy to be part of this winning team.

Me and my husband went this morning after viewing many good reviews. The menu was confusing as to what "side items" goes with what. The flapjacks were good. This can be my second choice for the flapjacks. The first is still The Original Pancake House. We ordered western omelet which was boring. And it looks like they cook the ingredients separate then throw it together. The eggs are cooked and after that their throw the rest of the ingredients inside and slice of plain american cheese inside, which was barely melted. The house coffee was just ok. However, the service was very good. if we come back it will be for the flapjacks.

Stopped by this location en route to a doctors appointment in the Pineville area. I was in search for vegan breakfast options and there were certainly slim pickings in the area. I love famous toastery but hadn't been since adopting a vegan diet. I perused the menu and figured I could probably finagle a vegan breakfast. 

I ordered the fruit cup, bagel with peanut butter and the potatoes without butter.  Everything turned out really good. I was especially surprised by the potatoes. It wasn't their typical potato perfection. But they were delicious nonetheless especially considering that this is an off-the-cuff vegan work-around.  The fruit cup was delicious and fresh as always.  My least favorite thing was the bagel not because of the flavor but because of the thickness. It was definitely a "roll with a hole" but the thinner half was a perfect conduit for the peanut butter. 

All in all a good clutch vegan meal and would probably work if I had to come here with family or friends for breakfast.  They still hold the title as one of my top breakfast spots in Charlotte.

The only reason this location didn't get the five stars that university location did (see my review) is because my server was a bit short and gruff. He wasn't altogether horrible, just not the best.  Even still, when I have my appointments on this side of town I will definitely stop in for breakfast.

My wife and I have been regulars for years (before and after baby) and loved this place. Recently the service (mostly the kitchen speed) has tanked. We've switched our morning routine to other businesses. If you can't give me good service and speed, then it's not work paying you extra for breakfast. Hope they turn it it around.

Toast has - hands down - the best grits I have ever had.  I go there every chance I get for breakfast just to experience them!  Yes, the rest of the food is great and the service is good...but it is the grits that draw me in.  My favorite thing to have with my grits is the greek omelet...but the french toast is also good.  It is on the expensive side, but well worth it for a low key, no stress, great breakfast or lunch.

Top notch place for breakfast!  People and service are outstanding as well.  Have been on a smaller portion deit for several years so the serving was three times what I should eat.  It was so good I cleaned my plate and skipped lunch. Even had Rye Bread toast.

I enjoyed this place for brunch. They have breakfast & lunch menu, as well as brunch specials.  My husband got the French toast and he loved it.  I got the Tuna salad (add cucumber) and pasta salad side...u must say the food is very fresh.  We will definitely be back.

Love this place. Service is spot on and the food is always yummy. Best thing is they have gluten free pancakes if your kid is allergic like mine. I wish the corn muffins were gluten free, my kid would love them.

I have to admit being slightly disappointed with my experience at this restaurant. My wife had the crab salad special with grits. They brought her grits first, then brought another bowl with the meal. They were quite plane and ordinary, nothing special. They did take her dish back and bring the cucumber salad which was ok. The crab salad didn't really taste of crab but had an overpowering flavour despite a good amount of crab in it. She said the roll tasted better than the crab. 

I had the classic eggs Benedict. They have many so I tried the original to compare with other places I've tried. The hollandaise was bland, the eggs undercooked with runny whites. It came with a side of fried potatoes which had their skins on and were delicious with good seasoning and a great fried texture. Oddly enough the coffee was both weak and bitter. Not quite as bad as Cracker Barrel, but not that great either. 

Overall, not really worth $40 and I doubt I'd be back.

Toast in Ballantyne satisfied my brunch craving while I was in town for the Thanksgiving holiday. Joe and I are spoiled and do brunch at least every other weekend and for the options available to us, I certainly feel that Toast is better than what we could have done. Toast had some creative menu items but not enough oomph to really be great.

It was alright, I've only ever been to this location but would love to try the Ballantyne location.  The breakfast isn't that good if you ask me, the ambience is good but you could get a better breakfast with more variety elsewhere. I got the crab cakes with hollandaise sauce and they were not very good. I'd take Terrace Cafe over this place any day.
Their pancakes and stuffed French toast are really good.  if you go on Sunday for brunch, they also serve you corn bread with apple jelly.

We went here for Father's Day brunch and there was a 45 minute wait at 930AM (not entirely surprising). When we were seated, our experience was good! The wait staff seemed a bit stressed (& hot & sweaty, noticeably), but very nice. The complimentary cornbread they brought to the table was good, & our meals came out fairly quickly. Great California Benedict, super tasty. The only negatives were the wait & feeling a bit rushed as there were so many people waiting...that, & maybe consider slightly bigger tables! With all the condiments and additional bowls, plates & general 'stuff' that comes along with breakfast, we were spilling over w/ almost no room for our main plates. Otherwise, good food! Will return, though likely not for a Sunday or holiday brunch.
Great bacon is always the test of a breakfast place. Missing Skillet's, but Toast fills the niche nicely.

This place was way below what I expected due to the restaurant service and overall experience. I will give it to the fact that they either had turnover in management or just highly ineffective service. The restaurant was half full and we (2 people) had to wait 15 minutes to sit down. It was like no one was communicating to other people that tables were done and get them ready to serve.

Nevertheless, after ordering we had to wait even more!! We even over heard the waiters apologizing to another table that sat down before us about the wait in food. In total what should be an hour max brunch/lunch turned into two hours with all the waiting. 

So I must talk about the food as well. It was sub-par at best. I got the breakfast bowl and it was bland and slightly soggy. I am not a professional cook and my food taste so much better! I am in no rush to ever go back and I highly recommend other places for your brunch/lunch. 

This is shocking for me to even say because the other location in Dilworth is so much better! I can't apologize for being to harsh when it was below okay.

Service: A+
Location: A - Ballantyne
Prices: B+
Options/Menu:  A+
Food: A

What a wonderful place!!  This is something that Ballantyne needs a little bit more of.  We are lacking good breakfast spots.  What makes Toast so unique is their menu and service.  It's not just the typical greasy breakfast spot that rushes you in and out.  You have healthy options if you need them and some extremely delicious dessert'ish breakfast choices.  Like numerous stuffed french toast options and omelettes galore!!  The tomato avocado cheese omelette was superb.  Big and fluffy with all fresh ingredients.  The wife and I will definitely be back and will probably bring some friends.  

Enjoy!

-Ian M.

Food was ok. Been here twice. Today we ordered the avocado omelette (as recommended by the server) and there was not much avocado in there... but there was a lot of bacon! My husband would have loved the bacon! The coffee was warm, not hot.  The service was fine. Not one of my top places.

Dined here for the second time. There are positives and negatives to this place. The positives are from meals that weren't mine. I've tasted their quiche and French toast, both of which are awesome. My two meals were underwhelming. I was excited to see corned beef hash and that's something I'll always order when available. The disappointment was that I struggled to locate much meat in my potatoes. It was probably a 10% corned beef to 90% potato ratio. Today I ordered the Left Coast BLT. Everything on the sandwich was great but for such a large sandwich, I had only three pieces of bacon... On a BLT! I had to combine the ingredients from both halves of the sandwich to make one decent sized "half sandwich". It appears the folks at this place are extremely stingy on the meats. I doubt I'll return.
We have been here several times for Sunday brunch. It's always fantastic and service is prompt and with a smile. They are always switching up the menu with new and fresh specials.

I ordered french combo from the griddle section that came with french toast(or choice of pancake), scrambled egg(any egg style) and sausage(or choice of bacon). This is my first time and my expectation might be high. The food was mediocre. The portion of scrambled egg was not enough for me and french toast was not that thick and moist. For the price, it was just okay.
The food is amazing!! Staff are friendly and not invasive at all. Their flapjacks and French toast are the best I've had in Charlotte! Definitely come here for brunch.

Overrated. Not bad by any means. But also no different than any other breakfast place I've ever been to. Espresso is good, but the coffee sucks. Place always has ridiculous waits and it's expensive for breakfast. Might as well go to ihop.

Excellent breakfast, and the service was excellent.  Our coffee cup was never empty, the food came out promptly!  My friend and I both had the Eggs Benedict.  The waiter asked how we wanted our eggs poached--probably the best Eggs Benedict I've had in a while.  The eggs were poached perfectly, the whites weren't runny, and the yolks, liquid gold!  Warm eggs yolks with the hollandaise sauce-nothing better.  You don't have just one server, but a team, anyone on their or in the area, made sure things were good.  They cleared plates fast, just attention to detail.  There were so many items on the menu--I can wait to go back!
A good variety of things to eat. The lobster Benedict for Sunday brunch was amazing. Love how the inside is decorated like a farm house

Really like the corn bread here. The variety of choices is also very nice. I ordered the avocado omelet and my bf ordered the country benedict. We also have the roasted vegetables on the side. Both taste delicious. The service is pretty good too.

I'm a fan of Toast.  I like the one in Dilworth, the one in Davidson and this one at Ballantyne.  I have had some things that left me disappointed but 9 times out of 10 I leave full, satisfied and NOT broke.  

One of my favorite dishes is the peanut butter/banana french toast.  I mean, can you go wrong with that combination?  I also love their breakfast burritos and their scrambler skillets.  The one I tried this past weekend had jalapenos, cheese, and chorizo.  It was delicious.  I am also typically a fan their "specials."  They have very good crepes, specialty pancakes, quiches, etc.  They offer a wide variety of breakfast/brunch/lunch items and they are typically pretty scrumptious.

The service is good and personal.  The owner of Ballantyne and Park road locations is a very nice guy that seemed to recognize us after only meeting us one time.  Our most recent visit to the Ballantyne location we met the owner's brother who is apparently the new manager.  He was VERY friendly and seemed genuinely interested in his customers.  I really like these fellas and their food.  That's all.  goodbye.
Food was good, service was good but my goodness is this place expensive.  I can get as good of food and even better service at Victoria's in Clover SC for half the price.

So, I have only previously been to the Toast location in Dilworth.  So, after Mass this past Sunday my Mom actually decided that we could give a new place a shot, crazy since we always end up at the same place. I was excited.  On our way there I called ahead and was able to put our name in, which is a definite bonus.  I was given a 25 minute wait time so we only had to wait about 10 minutes once we arrived and I let them know we were there.
Once we were seated the confusion began.  We seemed to have three people waiting on us, asking the same questions. Finally I had to tell one of them we have already given our drink orders.  We were also seated by a door on the side of the restaurant, which servers and the Manager were running in and out of so the cold kept coming in. Not pleasant at all. The party next to us actually requested to be moved, but we held out since there would have been a long wait for another table.
My Mom order the crepe special which she loved.  However, she could not touch her Bloody Mary as it was a cup of horseradish. I had it send back and she ordered a mimosa which she was much happier with.
I chose the MBS, mushroom, bacon, and swiss omelette and added peppers and onions. The mushrooms seemed like they were overcooked, very soggy! Or, maybe out of a can? And, the peppers and onions were not cooked at all. 
Overall it was just okay. But, as I think I feel about the other location, rushed service, confusion, and okay food, it applies here as well.
Amazing service! And great food, strongly recommend the avocado benny and the banana peanut butter French toast.

I have tried the toaster twice the service was fantastic but the food was just ok. I came once for lunch and once for breakfast and both time I left slightly disappointed.  Especially considering the long weekend wait.

Love love love this restaurant. I treat me and mom to brunch here. Flavors are amazing! French toast to die for perfect amount of fluffiness and crispy too. Not overly sweet but just perfect with the maple syrup that tastes like the real deal. I had a basic egg combo plate and loved the sides bacon was nice and thick. All very reasonable for the pice (@10 or under) . Left so happy and full. You can tell they put care into the foods to produce such fresh flavors!

Nice wait staff. Busy place. Food is ok. My wife ordered an omelet with eggs whites and she got regular eggs. Had to send it back. The second time around the potatoes that came with the omelet were missing.

Great breakfast!
We had lobster Benedict with a dill hollandaise 
The SMB omelet with egg whites, pumpkin pancakes and a turkey Ruben
Everything was delicious!! Service is great, food came out very fast and nice and hot!
We will definitely be going back!!!

Corned beef hash was great. Not all greasy like some places. I'm not a fan of hollandaise Sauce so I left it off and I will get it again and again. If you look at the picture you can tell how much I liked it.

We went to Toast today for a very late breakfast.  The place was packed but we didn't need to wait for a table.  We both had omelets; my husband had the Western and I had The Usual-filled with apple sausage and huge chunks of grilled onions that tasted like they had been pre-saut√©ed prior together and a bit of cheddar (I think). I'm not a huge fan of a lot of cheese with my eggs so that was a good thing.  After ordering it felt like only 5 minutes had passed before our plates were ready.  
 
While the food was very good, I'm giving 5 stars for the service which was outstanding from the minute we walked in until we left. Everyone seemed genuinely happy to be there.  They were very attentive but not in that annoying stalking sort of way. And for that reason, I will be back. Two thumbs up!

Usually, one of my favorites places for Brunch on Sunday. The service and food is usually great. HOWEVER, on 8/16, very disappointed. Second weekend in a row for us they ran out of my wifes order. 15 mins AFTER we ordered, waitress told us they were out of the Spinach Quiche on the brunch menu. How did she not know it was running low when we orderd? She then said " we should be there by 10 am or it'll run out".   I thought it was a BRUNCH, not breakfast menu. So then she ordered egg breakfast with biscuit. They delivered the eggs, then said they were out of biscuits. The waitress later came by to see how things were, and when we told her they were also out of her biscuit, she gave a little laugh, and just left?!?  Never did a manager come by so I guess she didnt bother telling anyone. I worked in restaurants for years during college and its all about communication from the kitchen, and attention to the details, from open to close. Either they didnt tell her what was running low, or she didnt hear them. Let us know before we order!. My potatoes were cold, the toast was bone cold, no butter on it or delivered...just the little things add up to a disappointing experience, again.
We'll try again , hopefully, they pay attention to the details until 3 pm next time.

Had brunch here a little while back and greatly enjoyed it. The omelette was delicious, the sides were delicious as well, the service is good and the atmosphere is relaxed. I have to take one star off for the prices though; they seem rather high for the amount of food you get but despite that I'll be back for sure.
